field_edited_text.value:
III. DISPOSITION POLICY AND PROCEDURE



The following' Disposition Policy and Procedure for Development Area 12
has been formally adopted by the Commission of the Baltimore Urban Re-
newal and Housing Agency. All specific requirements which must be met
by a developer in submitting a proposal will be found in this Section IIIL.

A. DISPOSITION POLICIES APPLICABLE TO DEVELOPMENT AREA 12,
CHARLES CENTER



1. Basic Objectives of the Agency. The objectives of the Agency
in offering Development Area 12 are to secure the best possible
development in the.interests of the City, as determined by the
Agency, and a price for the land which is not less than its fair
value.



2. Conformance with the Plan. The disposition documents conform
to the Urban Renewal Plan for Charles Center, as amended.



3. Selection of Developer. Each proposal will be reviewed and
evaluated in order to select the bestarchitecturaland functional
design submitted by a qualified developer. The selection pro-
cess willinvolve detailed consideration of the quality of the de-
velopment proposed by each developer, and the identity of the
developer and his qualifications. A qualified developer is one
who, in the opinion of the Agency, has the necessary experience
and financial resources to enable him to complete the develop-
ment of Area 12 within the prescribed time limits. The selec-
tionprocess will be designed toavoid having interested develop-
ers make extensive expenditures for preparation of proposals,
since only a single developer will eventually be selected.



4, Cooperation with Developers Throughout the Entire Development
Program. Disposition documents will recognize the continuing
interest which developers and the Agency share throughout the
development process. The Agency will require that each de-
velopment harmonize with other developments in Charles Center,
and will require that each developer cooperate in an architec-
tural review process designed to achieve this objective.
